sentence.text: BACKGROUND Epigenetic modifications in host cells, like p16 G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle methylation, have been considered as putative complementary mechanisms for cancer development.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: OBJECTIVES We hypothesised that p16 G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle methylation might have a role in cancer development driven by HPV16, mainly in the presence of intact E1/E2 genes.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: Methylation status of the p16 G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle promoter was assessed by methylation-specific PCR in 87 cervical specimens comprising 29 low-grade (LSIL), 41 high-grade (HSIL) lesions, and 17 cervical cancers (CC).

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: FINDINGS We observed a significantly increased trend (nptrend = 0.0320) in the proportion of methylated p16 G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle in cervical samples during cancer development.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: MAIN CONCLUSIONS There was an increase in methylation of the p16 G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle promoter from pre-neoplastic lesions to cancer.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle
